question: Question_02_(a)_iii
hints:
As $x \to \infty$, what does $e^{-x}$ approach? Can you think of a way
to rewrite this limit in terms of a different variable?

If the value of the limit

\begin{align*}\lim_{z \rightarrow 0}\frac{\sin{z}}{z}\end{align*} is unfamiliar to you, it can
be evaluated using
\href{http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L\%27H\%C3\%B4pital\%27s_rule}{L'Hopital's
rule} or by using the fact that

\begin{align*}\sin(z) \approx z - \frac{z^{3}}{6}\end{align*} for $z$ near 0.
